com.compendium.core.datamodel
Class Link

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.datamodel.PCObject
      com.compendium.core.datamodel.IdObject
          com.compendium.core.datamodel.Link
All Implemented Interfaces:
IIdObject, ILink, IPCObject, ICoreConstants, java.io.Serializable
public class Link
extends IdObject
implements java.io.Serializable, ILink

A Link represents a relationship between two nodes. The link in itself does not have any meaning. A type can be given to the node to give it some meaning.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getLink

public static Link getLink(java.lang.String sLinkID,
                           java.util.Date dCreationDate,
                           java.util.Date dModificationDate,
                           java.lang.String sAuthor,
                           java.lang.String sType,
                           java.lang.String sOriginalID,
                           java.lang.String sLabel,
                           int nArrow)
Return a link object with the given id and details. If a link with the given id has already been created in this session, update its data and return that, else create a new one, and add it to the list.

Parameters:
String - sLinkID, the unique identifier for this Link.
java.util.Date - dCreationDate, the date the Link was created.
java.util.Date - dModificationDate, the date the link was last modified.
String - sAuthor, the name of the porson who created this Link.
Stirng - sType, the type of this link.
String - sOriginalID, the original ID of this link if/when imported.
sLabel, - the label for this Link.
int - nArrow, the type of arrow heads draw on this Link.

getOriginalID

public java.lang.String getOriginalID()
Returns the object's original id. When importing maps we need to make sure that objects with the same id end up as the same project compendium object.
